ratings.note: JV between TUI AG (publicly traded) and Royal Caribbean. Investment-grade adjacent given parent support.

overview.business_description: Premium cruise operator offering holiday voyages primarily for German-speaking customers. Focuses on inclusive onboard experiences under the 'Mein Schiff' brand. Joint venture between TUI AG and Royal Caribbean Cruises.
business_positives: Low distress score of 8 - performing credit
All bonds trading at or ABOVE PAR (100-104)
Strong JV parents - TUI AG and Royal Caribbean
Recent EUR 375m notes at 5% (Nov 2024) - tight pricing
TUI parent EBIT flat YoY at EUR 1.25bn (Dec 2025)
overview.fatal_flaw: Feb 2026 buyer credit maturity approaching ($1.04bn). Cruise sector remains capital-intensive with high fixed costs. TUI parent had COVID restructuring (Mar 2020). Some 2026 bond maturities need refinancing.
overview.ownership: Private JV. 50% TUI AG (German publicly traded travel company) and 50% Royal Caribbean Cruises (US publicly traded cruise operator).
overview.recent_news: TUI 4Q24-25 underlying EBIT flat YoY at EUR 1.248bn (Dec 2025). Priced EUR 375m senior unsecured 2030 note at 5% (Nov 2024). Strong recovery from COVID disruption.

quick_assessment.note: JV structure - financials at parent level. Strong parent support from TUI AG and Royal Caribbean.

key_ratios.note: Financials consolidated at TUI AG and Royal Caribbean parent level

maturity_schedule.note: 2026 maturities significant (~$1.6bn) but manageable with parent support

credit_opinion.summary: TUI Cruises is a performing credit with low distress score (8) and all bonds trading at or above par (100-104). The JV structure with TUI AG and Royal Caribbean provides strong parent support. Recent EUR 375m issuance at 5% (Nov 2024) demonstrates continued market access. Premium 'Mein Schiff' brand serves affluent German-speaking customers. Post-COVID cruise demand recovery has been strong. While 2026 maturities are significant (~$1.6bn including buyer credit), the strong parents should support refinancing. TUI parent EBIT stable at EUR 1.25bn.

distress_indicators.trading_signals: All bonds at 100-104 (at/above par). Recent 5% issuance shows tight pricing. Strong JV parents. Low distress score. 2026 maturities need addressing but parent support strong.
